citations.narrative:
On April 26, 2025, it was reported that a rhesus macaque went without access to water for two days due to the water
hose being improperly connected to its cage. During this time the animal had water rich fruit and vegetable enrichment
was consumed, therefore no additional treatment was needed. Lack of potable water in sufficient quantity to nonhuman
primates can negatively impact their health and well-being by resulting in dehydration, and possible death. Potable water
must be provided in sufficient quantity to every nonhuman primate housed at the facility. If potable water is not continually
available to the nonhuman primate, it must be offered to them as often as necessary to ensure their health and well-being.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representatives.
n

narrative:
3.83  Repeat
   
Watering. 
On April 26, 2025, it was reported that a rhesus macaque went without access to water for two days due to the water 
hose being improperly connected to its cage. During this time the animal had water rich fruit and vegetable enrichment 
was consumed, therefore no additional treatment was needed. Lack of potable water in sufficient quantity to nonhuman 
primates can negatively impact their health and well-being by resulting in dehydration, and possible death. Potable water 
must be provided in sufficient quantity to every nonhuman primate housed at the facility. If potable water is not continually 
available to the nonhuman primate, it must be offered to them as often as necessary to ensure their health and well-being. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representatives.
